thread.title_full: UPDATE 1-Nexstar offers to buy Media General for $4.1 bln | Reuters

author: Reuters
title: UPDATE 1-Nexstar offers to buy Media General for $4.1 bln
text:
(Adds details, share movement)
Sept 28 (Reuters) - Nexstar Broadcasting Group Inc said it has offered to buy Media General Inc in a deal that would value Media General at $4.1 billion and make the combined company the second biggest local TV station operator in the United States.
A deal would derail Media General's agreement to buy Meredith Corp for about $2.34 billion to create the industry's No. 3 regional player.
Nexstar has offered $10.50 per share in cash and 0.0898 of its shares for each Media General share.
The offer, which works out to $14.50 per share, represents a premium of 30 percent to Media General's Friday close.
Media General's shares were trading at $14.05 before the opening bell on Monday.
A combination with Nexstar would create more synergies than Media General's proposed deal with Meredith, Nexstar said in a letter to Media General's board.
"It is illogical that Media General's Board has refused to engage with us and has instead pursued an ill-conceived and value-destructive acquisition of Meredith that would once again expose Media General shareholders to the risks of the low-margin publishing business," Nexstar Chief Executive Perry Sook said in a statement.
Nexstar said a deal with Media General would help generate pro-forma annual free cash flow in excess of $450 million.
It also said the combined company would be the second-biggest owner of major network affiliates, reaching 39 percent of all U.S. television households.
BofA Merrill Lynch is financial adviser and Kirkland & Ellis LLP is legal counsel to Nexstar. (Reporting by Natalie Grover and Lehar Maan in Bengaluru; Editing by Sriraj Kalluvila and Saumyadeb Chakrabarty)
